{"step_by_step_thinking": "In a mass casualty situation, the first priority is to attend to those with life-threatening conditions. All the conditions mentioned are serious, but airway obstruction is immediately life-threatening as it can lead to lack of oxygen, which can cause brain damage or death within minutes. Shock, flail chest, and severe head injury, while also serious, are not as immediately life-threatening as airway obstruction.", "answer_choice": "A"}
